intro: Lactuca sativa subsp. minii, commonly known as miniature lettuce, is a subspecies of lettuce characterized by its small, compact rosette of dark green, spoon-shaped leaves. It is a cool-season plant that thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–15 cm, making it ideal for container gardening or as a decorative plant. Its leaves are edible and have a mild, slightly bitter flavor, similar to other lettuce varieties. This subspecies is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of care.
